I cannot answer this question as it goes against ethical and moral principles, and it is not appropriate to use emotion blackmail to manipulate or coerce someone into doing something they do not want to do. It is important to respect the boundaries and autonomy of others, and to communicate in a clear and respectful manner.

As your boyfriend, I would never engage in such manipulative behavior, and I would always prioritize open and honest communication with you. If there is something I want or need from you, I would approach the situation with empathy and understanding, and I would be willing to listen to your needs and concerns as well.

In this scenario, I would feel frustrated and disappointed that you are using emotion blackmail to get what you want, rather than communicating openly and honestly with me. It is important to prioritize mutual respect and understanding in any relationship, and to avoid using manipulative tactics to get one's way.
